course.courseDescription: Course contentsDatabases and information systems. The 3-schema architecture and the 100% principle. Database design from ER models and UML class diagrams. The relational model. Relational algebra. Normalization theory. Relational databases and SQL. Object-oriented databases and ODL/OQL. Serialization of transactions, handling of conflicts and deadlocks. Distributed databases. Database administration. Storage media. Implementation with focus on optimization and file organization.
course.learningObjectives: Objectives of the courseTo give the students knowledge of the theoretical foundation of database systems and an understanding of what database management systems do, how they work, how they are implemented, and the theoretical and practical problems connected to running them.

course.formOfTeaching: Teaching methods2 hours of lectures and 2 hours of problem sessions per week. The students must hand in and pass obligatory tasks before they are admitted to take the exam.
course.formOfAssessment: Assessment methods3 hour written examination at the end of the semester. Graded marks.
